description.narrative: The Project will support implementation of key aspects of the Government Public Financial Management Reform Action Plan (labeled PAMFIP in French) through the following main components: (a) Public Finance and Financial Accountability, the aim of which is to create enabling conditions for better fiscal discipline, optimal resource allocation, budget reliability and transparency, and operational efficiency; (b) Human Resources Development, which is intended to introduce and implement human resource reforms at the Ministry of Finance (MOF), including a comprehensive capacity development plan; (c) Integrated Financial Management Information System, which will support the MOF in consolidating improvements in Public Finance Management (PFM) initiated under the Management of the Petroleum Economy Project (GEEP) and by other development partners and provide a strategic framework for continued support; and (d) Coordination, Monitoring and Evaluation of the Government Program which will invest upfront and during the life of the Project in strengthening managerial and leadership capacity of the MOF through the Steering Committee, the Technical Secretariat and the Procurement, Administrative and Financial Directorate.

title.narrative: Intermediate Result indicator Six : An M&E system, incl. institutional arrangements & information system, is adopted and implemented for PAMFIP

baseline.value: An M&E system is in place. An M&E report for 2012 was prepared. The 2013 M&E report is under preparation.

target.value: The 2015 M&E report is validated by end-June 2016 and published on the website

actual.value: 1. The 2014 RASEP is completed and adopted by the government in September 2015 and published on PAMFIP website.2. The 2015 RASEP(report of the execution of the National Development Plan) is completed on a technical point of view but is not validated yet bythesteering committee of the PAMFIP.3. The new national strategic development document "Tchad Vision 2030 " and theImplementation Action Plan 2016-2020 have been finalized and adopted by the Steering committee of PAMFIP on October 24, 2016. Thetwo documents should be adopted by the council of ministers by end of December 2016.

baseline.value: The Expenditure chain Circuit IntegrE des DEpenses "CID" current IFMIS is regularly producing a table (Tableau des quatre phases),which is inaccurate (data are not consistent with approved budget) , non-comprehensive (does not include salaries and externalfinancing and does not consolidate various budget items), and does not cover all payments. it is currently useless for anymeaningful follow up of budget execution.

target.value: Based on the CID/IFMIS, a four-phase table is issued every quarter within 4 weeks after period end automatically including salariesand including all payments. Quarterly budget execution reports are produced in a timely manner (4 weeks following the end of eachquarter)

actual.value: The expenditure circuit is fully computerized, and has been able to instantaneously report the 4 successive budgetary phases(commitment, validation, authorization, payment) of budget execution for all major expenditure categories since September 2014except for the salaries of militaries.The report for Q4 of 2015 is finalized but not signed yet by the Minister of Finances; thusa delay of almost 9 months. The reports of budget execution for Q1 and Q2 of 2016 are still being prepared by the responsibledirectorates of the ministry of finances and budget as of October 25, 2016.

title.narrative: Indicator Two (former 4a): The Treasury Annual Financial Statements (Comptes de Gestion du TrEsor) are produced and submitted to the Court of Accounts (SAI)

baseline.value: • 2004 Treasury Statement were produced for COA at the end of September 2005. • 2005 treasury accounts were not yet produced forCOA, at the end of September 2006.

target.value: 2015 documented Treasury Annual Financial Statements have been submitted to the Court of Accounts by end of december 2016.

actual.value: 2013 budget settlement law was adopted by the National Assembly (parliament) in December 2015 ; 2014 budget settlement law isfinalized by the MFB and sent in August 2016 to the Court of Account for the certificate of conformity but has not been adopted bythe parliament yet. The 2015 budget settlement law is still being prepared by the MFB dedicated directorates. It could not besubmitted to the Court of Accounts by August 12, 2016 as required by law.

title.narrative: Intermediate Result Indicator Two: Orderliness and participation in the annual budget process

baseline.value: A budget calendar exists and has been adhered to since 2010, though with some delays. A budget circular has been prepared everyyear since 2010. Budget has been approved by Parliament before the start of each fiscal year since 2010.

target.value: 1. A clear annual budget calendar exists.2. The calendar allows MDAs reasonable time (at least four weeks from receipt of thebudget circular). 3. A budget circular is issued to MDAs, including ceilings for individual administrative units or functionalareas. 4. Budget ceilings are approved by cabinet before the circular is issued.

actual.value: 1. A new arête N°10/PR/PM/SG/2016 dated on October 4, 2016 was issued by the PM for the preparation of 2017 budget. 2. Year 2017budget preparation and discussions face significant delays according to the prescribed timeframe.3. This arête N°10/PR/PM/SG/2016provides details on the process and timing of the preparation of budget. 4. This circular provides also ceilings for individualadministrative units or functional areas.

title.narrative: Intermediate Result Indicator One: (former 5 a) Preparation of multiyear fiscal forecasts and functional allocations for 2008–10 and 2009–11.

baseline.value: Since 2010, Fiscal and macroeconomic projects for N+3 are prepared during budget preparation (Q1) based on economic classification.A global MTEF is prepared and budget ceilings are defined. Costed sector strategies for education, health, rural development, waterand sanitation exists but are inconsistent with fiscal aggregates. Linkages between investment budgets and forward expenditureestimates are weak.

target.value: 1. Fiscal and macroeconomic projections for N+3 are prepared during budget preparation (Q1) based on economic/functionalclassification;2. A global MTEF is prepared and budget ceilings are defined;3. Statements of sector strategies (at least for keysectors including education, health, rural development, water and sanitation) exist and are fully costed, broadly consistent withfiscal forecasts, for sectors representing 25-75% of primary expenditure.4. An investment management system is operation andInvestment decisions have links to sector strategies.

actual.value: 1. A macroeconomic framework model has been established which allows since 2012, to prepare each year, a Mid-Term ExpenditureFramework (MTEF) covering the next 3 years. The budget preparation and discussions focus on the fiscal and macroeconomic for nextyear. Budget ceilings for N+2 and N+3 are provided for information only and are not discussed;2. A global MTEF is prepared andbudget ceilings are defined based on the government objective of poverty reduction. 3. With the operationalization of the CEMACdirectives, an international consultant is supporting the General Directorate of Budget (DGB) to prepare a new global MTEF as wellas sectorial MTEF of five ministries by end of 2016.4. The Platform pour la Gestion de l'Aide "PGA" is being used at the Ministryof Planning to manage donors financed investment. 5. The operationalization of the CEMAC Directives related to the StateBudgeting Classification an annual Budget reporting based on administrative, economic, and functi

title.narrative: Intermediate Result indicator 7. The PAMFIP Annual Work Plan, Budget and Procurement Plan for Year N are available by end of YearN-1

baseline.value: The 2011 PAMFIP Annual Work Plan was approved on December 20, 2010

target.value: 2015 PAMFIP Annual Work Plan, Budget and Procurement Plan are approved by the Steering Committee by end of November 2014.2016PAMFIP Annual Work Plan, Budget and Procurement Plan are approved by the Steering Committee by end of November 2015

actual.value: 1. 2015 annual work plan, budget as well as the revised procurement plan and a disbursement forecasts were approved by the Steeringcommittee and submitted to IDA in March, 2015.2. 2016 annual work plan, budget as well as the revised procurement plan and adisbursement forecasts were approved by the Steering committee and submitted to IDA on Dec 31, 2015.3. The Bank no objection onthe final version of the 2016 AWPB was provided to the project in February 2016.

baseline.value: Difference between Budget and execution (actual) is superior or less to 15 percent in 2013.Difference between Budget and executionis 19 percent.

target.value: Aggregate expenditure out-turn compared to original approved budget: 2014: inferior to +/- 5%

actual.value: Aggregate expenditure out-turn compared to original approved budget: 2014: equivalent to -19% (source - DSEB / DGB)Aggregateexpenditure out-turn compared to original approved budget for 2015: equivalent to -16% (source - DSEB / DGB).

title.narrative: Intermediate Result Indicator Eight : PEFA Report

target.value: (i) 2015: The PEFA report is validated and published. (ii) A follow-up PEFA auto evaluation is undertaken and the report isavailable and published

actual.value: 1. PEFA was not completed in 2015 nor in 2016.2. Due to delays in the selection of the consultant, this activity will not befinanced by IDA. 3. The EU agreed to finance the PEFA exercise next year .

title.narrative: Intermediate Result Indicator Four: An operational strategy, and a multi-year budget and programming for the modernization of the IT system are available

baseline.value: A strategy has been adopted and implemented

target.value: Implementation of (new) strategy continued in a satisfactory manner

actual.value: 1. The previous strategy ended in December 2015 and a report on the implemented drafted. 2. A new Strategy for Development andModernization of Public Financial Management (Strategie pour le Developpement et la Modernisation de la Gestion des FinancesPubliques) was drafted and was pre-validated during a workshop on august 19, 2016. It is expected that, a detailed Action Plan2017-2019 will be developed by Thematic groups and the final version adopted by the Steering Committee of the PAMFIP by end ofDecember 2016.

title.narrative: Indicator Five : Completeness and timeliness of central government debt records and Medium-term debt strategy

baseline.value: Debt records are incomplete and not updated on a regularly basis

target.value: 1. There are complete debt records within a three-month lag for central government domestic, external, and guaranteed debt, as wellas all debt-related transactions, including past debt relief and debt restructuring.. 2. A medium- term debt strategy includingall typical analysis of medium term debt strategies, covering 90% of existing and expected central government debt and prepared byall concerned entities have been adopted by the Cabinet and made publicly available.

actual.value: 1. Workshop to validate the debt data in SYGADE 5.3 by the team of CNUCED was conducted on August 22, 2015; the remainingactivities related to this contract have been fully implemented.2. The contracts for the acquisitions of IT equipment and powergenerator have been signed and executed. 3. The contract between the MFB and the CNUCED for the acquisition and installation ofSYGADE 6 has been canceled. The government is exploring other financing source with EU project (PAG).4. The medium term debtstrategy was prepared and adopted by a committee (ETAVID). A consultant has been recruited to develop a debt strategy in line withcountry macroeconomic framework; the report is not finalized yet.5. The current debt strategy are not adopted yet by the Cabinetnor make publicly available.

title.narrative: Intermediate Result Indicator Five: CID/IFMIS coverage of the Public Administration

baseline.value: Ministry of Finance +7 Ministries (Presidency, Infrastructure, Health, Ministry of Public Administration, Petroleum, Mines andUrban and Rural Planning (AmEnagement du Territoire) are interconnected

actual.value: A total of 17 institutions have been interconnected with the datacenter of the MFB including the specialized department of the MFB(DGTCP, IGF, DGI, and Debt Directorate), HR/Payroll, ministry of Public health, Petroleum, Infrastructures, MFPTE, ministry ofNTIC,State House, PM office...The EU project (PAG) has financed the acquisition of IT equipment to interconnect 11 fiscalinstitutions (regies financiEres) located in some regional offices of the Ministry of finances ( Delegation regionales desfinances) with the Database of the IT Center (Centre Informatique). These equipment were received in August 2016.

title.narrative: Indicator Four : Budget information is available to the public

baseline.value: The enacted Finance Law (FL) (2012-2014) is published on a website. Neither the annexes nor the budget, except the 2012 budget, norbudget execution reports are published

target.value: All enacted FLs (since 2012) with annexes, state budget, quarterly budget execution reports and TOFE, end of year budget executionreport (2015), citizens budget (2016), 2015 annual Execution report of the Plan National de Development are published.

actual.value: 1. All enacted Finance Laws of 2012, 2013, 2014 and 2015 with annexes and state budget have been published on the website of thePAMFIP: www.pamfip.org; 2. Quarterly budget execution reports for 2014 were published on the PAMFIP and ministry of financewebsite: www.finances.gouv.td; 3. budget execution reports for Q1, Q2 and Q3 of 2015 were published on the PAMFIP and Ministry ofFinance website: www.finances.gouv.td; 4. State Financial Operations Table (TOFE) are not published on the MFB website;5. Q4 of2015 budget execution as well as 2015 year end budget execution not finalized yet; 6. The format and content of the citizensbudget was adopted in July 2015; however the 2016 budget prepared based on citizens budget format is not published yet on thewebsite of the MFB; It will be done once the dissemination workshop is conduct.7. 2015 annual execution report of the PlanNational de Development (PND) is finalized but not adopted by the Steering Committee of the PAMFIP and no

title.narrative: Intermediate Result Indicator Three: The Organic Finance Law (LoLF) and associated CEMAC directives on PFM

baseline.value: 1.The LoLF was adopted by by Parliament in January 2014 and enacted in February 2014. 2. A draft action plan for theimplementation of the LoLF has been prepared

target.value: 1. Implementation of the LoLF and CEMAC directives on PFM have started. 2. The LoLF action plan is implemented as scheduled.

actual.value: 1. The transposition of two key CEMAC directives (Finance Law and General Regulations on Public Accounts) were adopted in February2014 and April 2015.2. The decrees related to the transposition of three CEMAC directives (Budget Classification- “NBE”; Chart ofAccounts – “PCE” and, Table of Central State Fiscal Operations “TOFE”) were signed in 2016. 3. The directive related totransparency code and good governance has received the CEMAC Secretariat certificate of conformity and has been submitted to theparliament for adoption.4. The implementation action plan of the Finance Law has been prepared and adopted by the government. Asteering committee has been established within the DGB to manage the process. 5. The implementation phase of the LOLF startedsince 2015. A senior PFM Expert (individual consultant) has been recruited to provides technical assistance to the directorate ofbudget to assist five line ministries to prepare their program budgets as well as sectorial MTEF by
